p: 3. PPAR gamma activators. Peroxisome proliferator-activated receptors (PPARs) are key regulators of inflammation and lipid metabolism, their activation results specifically in a reduction in inflammatory cytokines (as IL6, INF γ) [ 40]. Rosiglitazone and pioglitazone (two PPARγ agonists) are insulin-mimetic drugs used in type 2 diabetes with high overall potential in reducing influenza virus infection [ 40]. Pioglitazone seems to suppress inflammation by reducing MCP-1 expression, an important mediator of host inflammation [ 40]. Pioglitazone was shown to increase survival of infected mice up to 40%, and the benefit may be attributed to modulation of subject inflammatory response [ 40, 41]. The combination of pioglitazone and AICAR increase survival of infected mice from 30 up to 100% [ 41]. Therefore, metformin, AICAR and PPARγ agonists, in combination or alone, might be studied and then used in the treatment of severe influenza in association with other antiviral/immunomodulatory drugs in the future.
